div.p:
The Commodore is
waiting to see you,

you suddenly changed course
and came here.

We received a subspace message
asking us

This base sent no message,
Captain.

You know, Jim, I just
can't understand this.

A message from the former
commander of the Enterprise,

urgently requesting
that we divert here.

Jim, I'm not doubting
anyone's word.
Jose, I...

I'm simply telling
you it's impossible.

There's been subspace chatter
about it for months.

I'm sorry to have to be the one
to show you.

He's upstairs in
the medical section.

We met when he was promoted
to Fleet Captain.

a big handsome man,
vital, active.

I took over the Enterprise
from him,

and Spock served with him
for several years.

Inspection tour
of a cadet vessel,

One of the baffle
plates ruptured.

He went in, bringing
out all those kids

Just wanted you gentlemen
to be prepared.

I thought you might make
an exception for them.

Chris, if there's anything
I can do for you...

may I remain
for a moment?
You know why I've come, Captain.

It's only six days away
at maximum warp,
and I have it well planned.

I have never disobeyed
your orders before, Captain...

p.span: where no man has gone before.

div.p:
Spock stated he received
a message for us to come here.
He entered same in his log.
That's all the proof I require.

And what do those
record tapes show?

No message received
by your vessel.

Then I suggest the record tapes
have been deliberately changed.

A computer expert can change
record tapes, duplicate voices,

The fact remains that
your First Officer's

and that same First Officer
seems to be the only one

who heard that message
ordering you here.

If he had wanted
to see Captain Pike,

he could have requested
a leave.

Who would want
to divert us here?

in the space sector
we're patrolling now,

all the record tapes
on the date in question?

Is there any way at all
a message could have been sent
from here without us knowing it?

We've checked and double-checked
everything possible.

Oh, have I introduced
Miss Piper, Jim?

This is Captain
Kirk, Miss Piper.

A mutual friend
described you, sir.

She merely mentioned
she knew you, sir.

You have something
to report, Miss Piper.

our investigation turned up
very little, Commodore.

Mr. Spock's years of service
with Captain Pike,

Miss Piper, a Vulcan can
no sooner be disloyal

than he can exist
without breathing.

That goes
for his present commander

We're forced to consider
every possibility, sir.

Captain Pike could not
have sent a message.
And totally unable to move, Jim.

to respond to
his brain waves.

Oh, he can turn it,
move it forwards

With a flashing light,
he can say yes or no.

That's as much as
that poor devil can do.

His mind is as active
as yours and mine,

Then there's no way
he could even have asked
for that message to be sent?

COMPUTER
( extremely slow speed):
Starbase Operations.

Stand by to receive new orders,
Enterprise.
Stand by to receive new orders.

They are to be fed directly
into the ship's computers.

This is top secret
and scrambled.

Sir, this is a
security area.

We need operating confirmation
from the ship's captain.
Uh, how can I handle the helm

if I don't know
where we're going?

KIRK:
Mr. Spock is with me here.

The ship's computers
will handle the helm

Course will be computed
and set automatically.

You will not discuss this
with ship's crew

We'll warp out of orbit
in one hour.

He's almost agitated himself
into a coma.
As long as any of us.

We've learned to tie
into every human organ

in the body except
one: the brain.

The brain is what
life is all about.

Now, that man can think
any thought that we can,

and love, hope, dream
as much as we can...

but he can't reach out,
and no one can reach in.

They could question him
for days, weeks,

before they stumble
on the right thing.

could this have anything
to do with Spock?

I don't read you
at all, Jim.
It was one of two things.

Either someone sent a message
diverting us here,

or someone on board the ship
lied about receiving it.
Could that someone be Mr. Spock?

Jim, forgetting how well
we both know Spock,

the simple fact
that he's a Vulcan

means he's incapable
of telling a lie.

And that half
is completely submerged.

To be caught acting like us
or even thinking like us

Someone's interfering with
my command and my ship!

I don't know who it is,
but I mean to find out.

If I thought you had
the technical know-how,

I'd suspect you, but
you don't-- Spock does!

He would not make
a false entry...

There's a false entry
in the log right now

which doesn't jibe with
the established facts.
I can't, but to question Spock,

I could run off half-cocked,
given a good reason.
So could you, but not Spock.

COMMUNICATOR:
Dr. McCoy,
report to Transporter Control.

You're needed
aboard the Enterprise, Doctor.
Sickness, injury? How bad is it?

That's all we have on it,
Doctor: Just "needed aboard".

I'll beam up
and let you know, Jim.

Oh, I'm certifying
I ordered you to read it.

Know anything at all
about this planet?

KIRK:
What every ship captain knows.

General Order Seven:
"No vessel under any condition,

emergency or otherwise,
is to visit Talos IV."

And to do so is the only
death penalty left on our books.

Not even this file
explains that.

But it does name
the only Earth ship

MENDEZ:
With a half-Vulcan
Science Officer named Spock.

Seems strange with
no navigator on duty.

The Enterprise knows
where she's going, Mr. Hansen.

Someone's trying
to hail us, sir.

I have been placed in temporary
command of the Enterprise.

SPOCK:
Starbase Command has assigned
Captain Kirk medical rest leave

that you will obey my orders
as you would his.

Who said Jim needed
a medical rest leave?

And this call about me being
needed aboard the ship?

And no one from the ship
made such a call.

they elected to keep
certain things from you.
Will you come with me, please?

I see that you're
still signaling "no".

I'm recording you
this message, Bones,

I'm sorry to have to make it
an order.

You are not to disturb
Captain Pike with any questions.
Simply take good care of him.

Follow Spock's instructions
to the letter.

Sir, scanners report
an object following us

about the size of a
Starbase shuttlecraft.

But at our speed,
they'll never catch us.

But in case they
want to reach us...

You have your orders,
Mr. Hansen.

Enterprise, Commodore Mendez
and Captain Kirk.

If you read me,
you are ordered to reply.

Repeating it on all
emergency frequencies, Jim.

Spock is headed for
Talos IV, all right.

If we turn back now,
we've just got barely enough
to get us back to the base.

Measure object now following
the Enterprise.

Computed. Object
is a Class "F" shuttlecraft.

Duranium metal shell,
ion engine power...

Stop. How long before
shuttlecraft's fuel supply

Shuttlecraft is already past
point of safe return.
You had no right to come along.

Part of me is hoping
that the Enterprise

We step on that deck,
Spock is finished,

He's dead... if he makes it
to Talos IV.

Why would he want
to get Pike there?

The Command report stated
Talos contained

absolutely no practical
benefits to mankind.

Spock would have some logical
reason for going there.

I keep wondering who might be
after us in a shuttlecraft,

and I keep coming up
with the same answers,

but I can't be right,
can I, Mr. Spock?

Computer control, lock onto
shuttlecraft following us.

COMPUTER:
Locked on. Tractor beam ready.
Go to tape Able Seven Baker.
Is it the captain, Mr. Spock?

She's brought herself
to a dead stop.

This is the First Officer
speaking.

Security, send an armed team
to the Bridge.

Lieutenant Hansen
is in operational command.

I present myself
to you for arrest.

I never received orders
to take command.

Mr. Spock is, um...
under arrest.

KIRK:
Store our shuttlecraft
on the hangar deck, Mr. Scott.

All right, Captain.
Locked onto you.

In his quarters, sir,
under arrest.

Tell whoever gave those orders
to report...

Sir, there's nobody up there
giving orders.

Mr. Spock has the computers
running the ship.

On voice command,
you will override

until vessel reaches
Planet Talos IV.

A ship in trouble

for a radio beam

I didn't say

could have done

You treat everyone on board like

And now you're

which mission is too risky

To the point of finally taking

To the point
